etymologies: early 19th century: from busy + -ness. The word business was used in the the sense ‘the state of being busy’ from Middle English down to the 18th century, but is now differentiated as busyness.

definitions: the state or condition of having a great deal to do

examples.text: it's easy to get caught up in the busyness of life
school started and the busyness began

shortDefinitions: condition of having great deal to do

definitions: the quality of being full of activity

examples.text: the busyness and noise of the street
the waitresses seemed unfazed by the busyness of the cafe

shortDefinitions: quality of being full of activity

definitions: the quality of being excessively detailed or decorated

examples.text: the busyness of the interior design
